page.title: 05RELIGION IN TODDINGTON 2
page.content: The{Baptist}Church, situated near the cemetry, was built in 1885. An annexe completed in 1984 is a Sunday School and Youth Club. An important feature of the Baptist faith is the Baptistry. The Baptistry here, is actually beneath a moveable pulpit. The{ {Catholic}Church, near Parkfields School, was converted in 1959 from old stables. In the same year the Church house and grounds were donated to the Diocese of Northampton. There is not a resident priest, but one from the Order of Vincentians in Dunstable says Mass. The{Methodist}Church, in the centre of the village, is 189 years old. It has an original graveyard which is not now used as the dead are buried in the Inter-Denominational{ {Cemetry}in the village. The Church has a preacher who lives in Toddington and a mainly local congregation.
